intro: Lepidaploa marguana, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and often have a pink or purple coloration. The plant is characterized by its latex-like sap, which can be toxic to some animals and humans.
